summary: Taylor Swift's album "1989," released in 2014, marked her transition from country to pop music. Co-produced with Max Martin, it was inspired by 1980s synth-pop and featured hits like "Shake It Off" and "Blank Space." The album spent 11 weeks at the top of the Billboard 200 and sold over 14 million copies worldwide. It won two Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year. Swift re-recorded the album in 2023 after a dispute over her back catalog.
title: 1989 (album)
